translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on laughing loudly
The training rule on laughing loudly

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mahāhasitaṁ hasantā antaraghare gacchanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū mahāhasitam hasantāḥ antaraghare gacchanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas, laughing loudly,

analyzed: na ujjagghikāya antaraghare gamissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not walk in inhabited areas laughing loudly,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not walk in inhabited areas laughing loudly.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca mahāhasitaṁ hasanto antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca mahāhasitam hasantaḥ antaraghare gacchati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area laughing loudly, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: anāpatti  a san cit ca  assatiyā
translated: There is no offense🔽if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,
if he just makes a little noise while laughing at something funny,
if he is the first offender.🔽The first training rule is finished.
